net.sf.mmm.util.exception.api

Class ValueOutOfRangeException

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • net.sf.mmm.util.exception.api.NlsRuntimeException
            • net.sf.mmm.util.exception.api.ValueException
              • net.sf.mmm.util.exception.api.ValueOutOfRangeException
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, NlsThrowable, AttributeReadMessage, AttributeReadMessageCode, AttributeReadUuid, NlsObject

    public class ValueOutOfRangeException
extends ValueException
    This is the exception thrown if a numeric value is not in the expected range.
    Since:
    7.2.0 (moved from 1.0.0)
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ValueOutOfRangeException

        protected ValueOutOfRangeException()
        The constructor for de-serialization in GWT.

      • ValueOutOfRangeException

        public ValueOutOfRangeException(V value,
                                V minimum,
                                V maximum)
        The constructor.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the generic type of the value that is out of range.
        Parameters:
        value - is the number that is out of range.
        minimum - is the minimum value allowed
        maximum - is the maximum value allowed.
        Since:
        7.1.0

      • ValueOutOfRangeException

        public ValueOutOfRangeException(V value,
                                V minimum,
                                V maximum,
                                Object valueSource)
        The constructor.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the generic type of the value that is out of range.
        Parameters:
        value - is the number that is out of range.
        minimum - is the minimum value allowed
        maximum - is the maximum value allowed.
        valueSource - describes the source of the value. This may be the filename where the value was read from, an XPath where the value was located in an XML document, etc. It is used in exceptions thrown if something goes wrong. This will help to find the problem easier.
        Since:
        7.1.0

        minimum - is the minimum value allowed
        maximum - is the maximum value allowed.

      • checkRange

        public static <V> void checkRange(V value,
                                  V minimum,
                                  V maximum,
                                  Object valueSource)
                           throws ValueOutOfRangeException
        This method checks that the given value is in the inclusive range from minimum to maximum.
        Type Parameters:
        V - the generic type of the value to check.
        Parameters:
        value - is the value to check.
        minimum - is the minimum number allowed.
        maximum - is the maximum number allowed.
        valueSource - describes the source of the value. This may be the filename where the value was read from, an XPath where the value was located in an XML document, etc. It is used in exceptions thrown if something goes wrong. This will help to find the problem easier. It may be null if there is no helpful source available.
        Throws:
        ValueOutOfRangeException - - if the given value is NOT in the range from minimum to maximum.
        Since:
        7.1.0

      • createMessage

        public static <V> NlsMessage createMessage(V value,
                                           V minimum,
                                           V maximum,
                                           Object valueSource)
        Creates a new error NlsMessage that the given value is not in the range from minimum to maximum.
        Type Parameters:
        V - is the generic type of the values. Needs to be an instance of Number or Comparable.
        Parameters:
        value - is the invalid value.
        minimum - is the minimum value or null if unbounded.
        maximum - is the maximum value or null if unbounded.
        valueSource - describes the source of value or null if unknown.
        Returns:
        the error NlsMessage.

      • getCode

        public String getCode()
        Description copied from interface: AttributeReadMessageCode
        This method gets the code that identifies the detailed type of this object. While UUID or ID are typically unique per instance of an object the code is unique for all instances of the exact same kind. So e.g. a particular kind of exception or ValidationFailure can be identified by its code. A simple generic implementation may return the classname or the key of the NLS message. However, the code should remain stable after refactoring (so at least after the rename the previous code should be returned as String literal). This code may be used as a compact identifier to reference the related problem or information as well as for automatic tests of error situations that should remain stable even if the message text gets improved or the locale is unknown.
        Specified by:
        getCode in interface AttributeReadMessageCode
        Overrides:
        getCode in class NlsRuntimeException
        Returns:
        the message text.
        See Also:
        Throwable.getMessage(), NlsThrowable, Message
